paper_abstract: For an odd prime p and two positive integers m, k such that m/gcd(k, m) >= 3 is odd, let d be a positive integer satisfying d(p(k) + 1) equivalent to 2 (mod p(m) - 1). In this paper, the cross-correlation between a p-ary m-sequence and its d-decimated sequences is investigated, and the cross correlation distribution is completely determined. The relationship between the decimations d considered in this paper and some known ones is also studied. This paper generalizes some previous results, and also gives new decimations, which lead to low cross correlation.
paper_title: Some Results on Cross-Correlation Distribution Between a p-Ary m-Sequence and Its Decimated Sequences
